definitions.definition: To press into small ridges or folds, to pleat , to corrugate .
examples: Cornish pasties are crimped during preparation.

definitions.definition: ( electricity ) To fasten by bending metal so that it squeezes around the parts to be fastened.
examples: He crimped the wire in place.

definitions.definition: To pinch and hold ; to seize .
To style hair into a crimp, to form hair into tight curls, to make it kinky .
To bend or mold leather into shape.
To gash the flesh, e.g. of a raw fish, to make it crisper when cooked.
( climbing ) to hold using a crimp

main_definition: To press into small ridges or folds, to pleat , to corrugate .
secondary_definitions: ( electricity ) To fasten by bending metal so that it squeezes around the parts to be fastened.
To pinch and hold ; to seize .
To style hair into a crimp, to form hair into tight curls, to make it kinky .
To bend or mold leather into shape.
To gash the flesh, e.g. of a raw fish, to make it crisper when cooked.
( climbing ) to hold using a crimp

definitions.definition: To impress (seamen or soldiers); to entrap , to decoy .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To impress (seamen or soldiers); to entrap , to decoy .
